bibRefCitation.author: Kepka, O.
bibRefCitation.refString: Kepka, O. (1962) Trombiculidae (Acari) aus der Turkey. Zeitschrift fur Parasitenkunde, 21, 273 - 289.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Schoutedenichia (Schoutedenichia) anatolica Kepka, 1962: 279
, figs. 4–7;
Kudryashova 1998: 254
, fig. 215.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. SIF = 4B-B-3-2000.0000; fPp = B/B/NNB; fCx = 1.1.1; fSt = 2.2; fSc: PL> AM> AL; Ip = 580–679; fD = 2H-(8–9)-(8–12)-(7–11)-(7–13)-…; DS = 50–58; VS = 44–64; NDV = 95–122. Standard measurements of specimens from the comparative material ( Russia : Krasnodarskiy Krai) are given in Table 30 .

Type material (not examined).
Holotype of
Schoutedenichia anatolica
was not designated, type material was deposited in IZUG. Type locality is Bergama in Turkey ( İzmir Prov. )
.
Holotype of
Kayella vercammeni
is deposited in ZISB; type locality is Stara-Zagora in Bulgaria
.
Syntypes of
S. pallidula
are deposited in ZMMU; type locality is Koktebel’ in Ukraine ( Crimea )
.
Holotype and paratypes of
S. abharica
are deposited in ZMMU; type locality is Ajami ( 37° 28' 56" N , 47° 12' 54" E ) in Iran ( East Azerbaijan Prov. )
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 30. Standard measurements of
Schoutedenichia anatolica
.

paragraph.tableNote: Note: For S, V min and V max n = 3, for other variables n = 10.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comparative material examined.
27 larvae (ZISP) ex
Apodemus ponticus
, RUSSIA : Krasnodarskiy Krai , 6 km S from Sukko , 44° 44' 22" N , 37° 24' 54" E ,
5–50 m a.s.l.
, relic juniper grove and deciduous forest (oak, hornbeam) near sea shore,
4–12 July 1992
, coll. AAS
;
25 larvae (ZISP) ex
A. ponticus
, ibidem, Vodopadnaya gorge, 44° 44' 53" N , 37° 24' 25" E ,
30 m a.s.l.
, deciduous forest (oak, hornbeam) near the stream,
13 July 1992
, coll. A.V. Bochkov and AAS
.

Hosts.
Mus musculus
L.,
Apodemus agrarius (Pallas)
,
A. sylvaticus
(L.),
Meriones persicus (Blanford)
,
Crocidura russula (Hermann)
plus
Apodemus ponticus (Sviridenko)
.

Distribution. Switzerland , Bulgaria , Romania , Ukraine , Turkey , Iran . Previous record in Turkey : Bergama ( Kepka 1962 ). This species is here recorded in Russia (Krasnodarskiy Krai) for the first time.
